English Sentences: Then said David to the Philistine, Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a shield: but I come to thee in the name of the LORD of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom thou hast defied.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Daawiti Pilisxxeemiyaa, "Neeni bisuwaa, bodaanne xinqqaa oiqqada ta bolli yaasa; shin taani Ubbaappe Wolqqaama GODAA sunttan, neeni naassido Israa7eela olanchchatu Xoossaa sunttan ne bolli yais.

English Sentences: This day will the LORD deliver thee into mine hand; and I will smite thee, and take thine head from thee; and I will give the carcases of the host of the Philistines this day unto the fowls of the air, and to the wild beasts of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hachchi GODAI nena ta kushiyan aatti immana; taani nena shocana; ne qooriyaakka muuca olana. Pilisxxeema olanchchatu ahaa saluwaa kafotuyyoonne sa7aa do7atuyyo taani hachchi immana; yaatin, Israa7eelan Xoossai de7iyoogaa sa7an de7iya asai ubbai erana.

English Sentences: And all this assembly shall know that the LORD saveth not with sword and spear: for the battle is the LORD's, and he will give you into our hands.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI ba asaa ashshanau toora woikko biso koyennaagaa hagan shiiqida asai ubbai erana; aissi giikko, olai GODAAGAA. I inttena ubbaa nu kushiyan aatti immana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose, and came, and drew nigh to meet David, that David hastened, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
Wolaitta Sentences: Pilisxxeemee denddidi biidi, Daawitaara olaa gaittanau shiiqido wode, Daawiti olettiyo baazzau eesuwan woxxiis.

English Sentences: And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sunk into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti ba qarcciitaa giddo kushiyaa yeddidi, issi shuchchaa ekkiis; ekkidi yambbarshshan wottidi yambbaridi, Pilisxxeemiyaa som77uwaa caddiis. SHuchchai bitaniyau som77o giddo geliis; yaatin, bitanee biittan gufannidi kunddiis.

English Sentences: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi Daawiti Pilisxxeemiyaa yambbarshshaaninne shuchchan xooniis. Daawiti ba kushiyan bisoi bainnan Pilisxxeemiyaa caddidi woriis.

English Sentences: Therefore David ran, and stood upon the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew him, and cut off his head therewith. And when the Philistines saw their champion was dead, they fled.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti woxxiiddi biidi, a bolli kiyi eqqidi, Pilisxxeemiyaa bisuwaa oiqqidi shoohuwaa giddoppe shoddi ekkidi, a qooriyaa muucidi woriis. Pilisxxeema asati bantta tooraa qarai haiqqidoogaa be7ido wode baqatidosona.

English Sentences: And the men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until thou come to the valley, and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even unto Gath, and unto Ekron.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela asainne Yihudaa asai denddidi alaahiiddi, Pilisxxeema asata Gaatenne Eqiroona katamatu penggeta gattanaashin yedettidosona; Pilisxxeema asaa ahai Gaatenne Eqiroona gakkanaashin, SHaa7iraima efiya ogiyan ubban kunddiis.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they spoiled their tents.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela asai Pilisxxeema asata yedetti simmidi, eti galchchidosaa bonqqidosona.

English Sentences: And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armour in his tent.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Pilisxxeemiyaa qooriyaa Yerusalaame ehiis; shin Pilisxxeemiyaa ola miishshaa ba dunkkaaniyaa giddon wottiis.

English Sentences: And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said unto Abner, the captain of the host, Abner, whose son is this youth? And Abner said, As thy soul liveth, O king, I cannot tell.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Pilisxxeemiyaakko biishin, Saa7ooli be7ido wode, olanchchatu halaqaa Abaneera, "Abaneeraa, ha wodallai o na7ee?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin Abaneeri Saa7oola, "Kawuwau, ne shemppoi ero taani a erikke" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: And the king said, Enquire thou whose son the stripling is.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi zaaridi, "Yaanikko ha wodallai o na7akkonne ane oichchada gakka" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him, and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Pilisxxeemiyaa woridi simmidoogaappe guyyiyan, muucido Pilisxxeemiyaa huuphiyaa oiqqidosaara, Abaneeri a Saa7oola sintti ekki efiis.

English Sentences: And Saul said to him, Whose son art thou, thou young man? And David answered, I am the son of thy servant Jesse the Bethlehemite.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli a, "Wodallau, neeni o na7ee?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin Daawiti, "Taani Beetaliheemiyaa ne ashkkaraa Isseya na7a" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul, that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Saa7oolaara haasayiyoogaa wurssidoogaappe guyyiyan, Saa7oola na7aa Yonaataani Daawitaara daro mata dabbotettaa medhdhiis; Yonaataani Daawita ba huuphedan siiqiis.

English Sentences: And Saul took him that day, and would let him go no more home to his father's house.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassaappe doommidi, Saa7ooli Daawita banaara wottiis; ba aawaa soo guyye simmennaadan diggiis.

English Sentences: Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yonaataani Daawita ba huuphedan siiqiyo gishshau, aara maachchaa maacettiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that was upon him, and gave it to David, and his garments, even to his sword, and to his bow, and to his girdle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yonaataani ba maayido kaabbaa qaaridi, ba ola maayuwaara, ba bisuwaara, ba wonddafiyaaranne ba qabattuwaara issippe Daawitayyo immiis.

English Sentences: And David went out whithersoever Saul sent him, and behaved himself wisely: and Saul set him over the men of war, and he was accepted in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul's servants.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli kiittido ubbabaa Daawiti polidi oottiyo gishshau, Saa7ooli Daawita ba olanchchatu giddon gadaawa sunttiis; hegee asaa ubbaakka a olanchchatakka ufaissiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass as they came, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with tabrets, with joy, and with instruments of musick.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Pilisxxeemiyaa Gooliyaada worin asai soo simmiyo wode, maccaasai ufaissa yettaa yexxiiddinne duriiddi, karaabiyaa baqqiiddinne diittaa diixxiiddi, Kawuwaa Saa7oola mokkanau Israa7eela katamatu ubbatuppe kiyiis.

English Sentences: And the women answered one another as they played, and said, Saul hath slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maccaasati duriiddi, "Saa7ooli sha7aa woriis; Daawiti tammu sha7aa woriis" yaagidi yexxidosona.

English Sentences: And Saul was very wroth, and the saying displeased him; and he said, They have ascribed unto David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed but thousands: and what can he have more but the kingdom?
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli ha yettai iitin, keehippe hanqqettiis; Saa7ooli ba qofan, "Daawita, Tammu sha7aa woriis giidi, tana, Issi sha7aa woriis giidosona; yaatin, kawotettappe attin ayyo aibee attidai?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Saul eyed David from that day and forward.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassaappe doommidi, Saa7ooli Daawita qanaate aifiyan xeelliis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass on the morrow, that the evil spirit from God came upon Saul, and he prophesied in the midst of the house: and David played with his hand, as at other times: and there was a javelin in Saul's hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi iita ayyaanai Xoossaappe kiitettidi, Saa7oola oiqqiis; oiqqin Saa7ooli ba son elumettiis. Daawiti haroodeegaadan diittaa diixxiis; diixxishin Saa7ooli tooraa ba kushiyan oiqqi uttidaagee,

English Sentences: And Saul cast the javelin; for he said, I will smite David even to the wall with it. And David avoided out of his presence twice.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Daawita godaara gattada sikkaas" giidi tooraa xonggiis. SHin Daawiti naa77utoo appe halettiis.

English Sentences: And Saul was afraid of David, because the LORD was with him, and was departed from Saul.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Saa7oola aggidi Daawitaara de7iyo gishshau, Saa7ooli Daawitayyo yayyiis.

English Sentences: Therefore Saul removed him from him, and made him his captain over a thousand; and he went out and came in before the people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Saa7ooli Daawita ba sinttappe haassidi, sha7u olanchchatussi halaqa kessiis. Yaatin, Daawiti ba citaa olan kaalettiis.

English Sentences: And David behaved himself wisely in all his ways; and the LORD was with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Daawitaara issippe de7iyo gishshau, i oottiyoobai ubbai ayyo injjetiis.

English Sentences: Wherefore when Saul saw that he behaved himself very wisely, he was afraid of him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti oottiyoobai ubbai keehippe injjetiyoogaa Saa7ooli be7idi, ayyo keehi yayyiis.

English Sentences: But all Israel and Judah loved David, because he went out and came in before them.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Daawiti eta olan kaalettiyo gishshau, Israa7eelanne Yihudaa asai ubbai a siiqidosona.

English Sentences: And Saul said to David, Behold my elder daughter Merab, her will I give thee to wife: only be thou valiant for me, and fight the LORD's battles. For Saul said, Let not mine hand be upon him, but let the hand of the Philistines be upon him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Saa7ooli Daawita, "Ta na7iyaa bairiyaa Meraaba hannaho; taani o neeyyo machcho immana; neeni mino asa gida; yaatada GODAA olaa oletta" yaagiis. Saa7ooli ba wozanan, "Taani a bochchikke; Pilisxxeema asati a worona" yaagidi qoppiis.

English Sentences: And David said unto Saul, Who am I? and what is my life, or my father's family in Israel, that I should be son in law to the king?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Daawiti Saa7oola, "Kawoora bollotanau taani oonee? Ta so asaikka aibee? Woikko ta aawaa yaraikka Israa7eela asaa giddon aibee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But it came to pass at the time when Merab Saul's daughter should have been given to David, that she was given unto Adriel the Meholathite to wife.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Saa7oola na7iyaa Meraaba Daawitau imettiyo wodee gakkin, Mahoola katamaappe yiida, Adirii7eela giyo issi bitaniyau imettaasu.

English Sentences: And Michal Saul's daughter loved David: and they told Saul, and the thing pleased him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gidikkonne, Saa7oola na7iyaa Miikaala Daawita siiqaasu; Saa7ooli hegaa siyidi ufaittiis.

English Sentences: And Saul said, I will give him her, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him. Wherefore Saul said to David, Thou shalt this day be my son in law in the one of the twain.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba wozanan, "Ayyo pire gidana malanne Pilisxxeema asati a worana mala, taani Miikaalo Daawitayyo immana" yaagidi qoppiis. Hegaa gishshau, Saa7ooli Daawita, "Neeni tanaara bollotanau hagee neeyyo naa77antto qaada" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Saul commanded his servants, saying, Commune with David secretly, and say, Behold, the king hath delight in thee, and all his servants love thee: now therefore be the king's son in law.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka Saa7ooli ba ashkkarata xeesidi, " Kawoi nenan ufaittiis; a ashkkarati ubbaikka nena dosoosona; ha77i neeni kawuwaara bollota yaagidi xuuran Daawitayyo yootite" yaagidi azaziis.

English Sentences: And Saul's servants spake those words in the ears of David. And David said, Seemeth it to you a light thing to be a king's son in law, seeing that I am a poor man, and lightly esteemed?
Wolaitta Sentences: Azazin eti i giidoogaadankka Daawitayyo yootidosona; shin Daawiti etau, "Kawoora bollotanaagee intteyyo laafabaa milatiiyye? Taani hiyyeesanne erettenna asa" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: And the servants of Saul told him, saying, On this manner spake David.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7oola ashkkarati Daawiti giidobaa Saa7oolayyo yootidosona.

English Sentences: And Saul said, Thus shall ye say to David, The king desireth not any dowry, but an hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the king's enemies. But Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yootin Saa7ooli ba ashkkarata, "Daawitau hagaadan yaagidi yootite; Kawoi ba morkketu haluwaa kessanau xeetu Pilisxxeema asatu qaaratuwaappe attin, neeppe hara koitaa koyenna yaagite" yaagiis. Saa7ooli hegaa giidoogee, "Daawiti Pilisxxeematu kushiyan haiqqo" giidi qoppido gishshaassa.

English Sentences: And when his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be the king's son in law: and the days were not expired.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7oola ashkkarati Saa7ooli giidobaa Daawitayyo yootidosona; kawuwaara bollotiyoogee Daawita ufaissiis. Hegaa gishshau, bullachchaa gallassai gakkanaappe kasetidi,

English Sentences: Wherefore David arose and went, he and his men, and slew of the Philistines two hundred men; and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full tale to the king, that he might be the king's son in law. And Saul gave him Michal his daughter to wife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawitinne a asai denddidi biidosona; biidi Pilisxxeematuppe naa77u xeetu asaa woridosona. Daawiti kawuwaara bollotanau he asatu qaaratuwaa ehiidi, kawuwaayyo kumettaa qoodidi sheedhdhiis. Hegaa gishshau, Saa7ooli ba na7iyo Miikaalo Daawitayyo immiis.

English Sentences: And Saul saw and knew that the LORD was with David, and that Michal Saul's daughter loved him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli GODAI Daawitaara issippe de7iyoogaanne a na7iyaa Miikaala Daawita siiqiyoogaa eriis.

English Sentences: And Saul was yet the more afraid of David; and Saul became David's enemy continually.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Saa7ooli Daawitayyo kaseegaappe aattidi yayyiis. Saa7ooli ba de7o laitta ubban Daawitayyo morkke gidiis.

English Sentences: Then the princes of the Philistines went forth: and it came to pass, after they went forth, that David behaved himself more wisely than all the servants of Saul; so that his name was much set by.
Wolaitta Sentences: Pilisxxeeme halaqati olettanau kiyiyoogaa aggibookkona; shin olau kiyido paido ubban Saa7oola gadaawatu ubbaappe xoonoi haniyoi Daawitassa; hegaa gishshau, i erettida asa gidiis.

English Sentences: And Saul spake to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should kill David.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli ba na7aa Yonaataanayyoonne ba ashkkaratu ubbaayyo, "Daawita worite" yaagidi yootiis; shin Saa7oola na7ai Yonaataani Daawita keehippe siiqiis.

English Sentences: But Jonathan Saul's son delighted much in David: and Jonathan told David, saying, Saul my father seeketh to kill thee: now therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself until the morning, and abide in a secret place, and hide thyself:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Yonaataani Daawitassi hagaadan yaagidi odiis; "Ta aawai Saa7ooli nena woranau koyees; wontto maallado neeyyo naagetta; issi sohuwan qosettada de7ashsha.

English Sentences: And I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where thou art, and I will commune with my father of thee; and what I see, that I will tell thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ta aawaara baada, neeni qosettido gaden eqqana; taani nebaa ayyo yootada, appe siyidobaa neeyyo yootana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan spake good of David unto Saul his father, and said unto him, Let not the king sin against his servant, against David; because he hath not sinned against thee, and because his works have been to thee-ward very good:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yonaataani Daawitabaa nashshidi, ba aawaa Saa7oola hagaadan yaagiis; "Kawoi ba ashkkaraa Daawita naaqqoppo; aissi giikko, i nena naaqqibeenna; i oottidobai nena keehi go77iis.

English Sentences: For he did put his life in his hand, and slew the Philistine, and the LORD wrought a great salvation for all Israel: thou sawest it, and didst rejoice: wherefore then wilt thou sin against innocent blood, to slay David without a cause?
Wolaitta Sentences: I Pilisxxeemiyaa woriyo wode ba shemppuwau qarettibeenna. GODAI Israa7eela ubbaayyo gita xoonuwaa immiis; hegaa be7ada neenikka ufaittadasa. Yaatin, neeni geeshsha asa naaqqanau aissi qoppai? Gaasoi bainnan Daawita woranau aissi koyai?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan: and Saul sware, As the LORD liveth, he shall not be slain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli Yonaataani yootidobaa siyidi, "De7o Xoossai ero, taani Daawita worikke" yaagidi caaqqiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan called David, and Jonathan shewed him all those things. And Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence, as in times past.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yonaataani Daawita xeesidi, haasayidobaa ubbaa yootiis. Yaatidi Daawita Saa7oolakko ehiis; ehin Daawiti Saa7oolaara kaseegaadankka de7iis.

English Sentences: And there was war again: and David went out, and fought with the Philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled from him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haranttuwaakka olai denddiis; Daawiti kiyidi Pilisxxeema asatuura olettiis; olettidi eta gita shochchaa shocin, eti a sinttappe baqatidosona.

English Sentences: And the evil spirit from the LORD was upon Saul, as he sat in his house with his javelin in his hand: and David played with his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe simmin, Saa7ooli tooraa oiqqidi ba son uttidaashin, iita ayyaanai GODAAPPE kiitettidi a oiqqiis. Yaatin, Daawiti diittaa diixxishin,

English Sentences: And Saul sought to smite David even to the wall with the javelin, but he slipped away out of Saul's presence, and he smote the javelin into the wall: and David fled, and escaped that night.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli Daawita godaara gattidi sikkanau tooraa xonggiis; shin Daawiti appe halettiis; halettin toorai godan torettiis. He gallassa qammi Daawiti baqatidi kessi ekkiis.

English Sentences: Saul also sent messengers unto David's house, to watch him, and to slay him in the morning: and Michal David's wife told him, saying, If thou save not thy life to night, to morrow thou shalt be slain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, "Daawita keettaa naagidi, maallado a worite" yaagidi Saa7ooli asaa Daawita soo kiittiis. Yaatin, Daawita keettaayyiyaa Miikaala, "Hachchi qammi neeni ne shemppuwaa ashshana xayikko, wontto haiqqaasa" yaagada Daawitayyo yootaasu.

English Sentences: So Michal let David down through a window: and he went, and fled, and escaped.
Wolaitta Sentences: Miikaala Daawita maskkootiyaara luuxissaasu; luuxissin Daawiti baqatidi kessi ekkiis.

English Sentences: And Michal took an image, and laid it in the bed, and put a pillow of goats' hair for his bolster, and covered it with a cloth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Miikaala so misiliyaa ekkada arssan zin77issaasu; zin77issada huuphessaara deeshsha ikisiyaa wottaasu; yaatada afalaa maizzaasu.

English Sentences: And when Saul sent messengers to take David, she said, He is sick.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawita omooddidi ehaana mala, Saa7ooli asaa kiittiis; kiittin Miikaala, "Daawiti sakettiis" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And Saul sent the messengers again to see David, saying, Bring him up to me in the bed, that I may slay him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Daawita be7ana mala, Saa7ooli he asata guyye kiittidi, hagaadan yaagiis; "Taani Daawita woranaadan a arssaara tookkidi ekki ehiite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when the messengers were come in, behold, there was an image in the bed, with a pillow of goats' hair for his bolster.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin asati soo geliyo wode, he so misilee arssan zin77idaagaa demmidosona; a huuphessaara deeshshaa ikisee de7ees.

English Sentences: And Saul said unto Michal, Why hast thou deceived me so, and sent away mine enemy, that he is escaped? And Michal answered Saul, He said unto me, Let me go; why should I kill thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli Miikaalo, "Neeni aissi hagaadan oottada tana cimmadii? Ta morkkee kessi ekkanaadan aissi baqatissadii?" yaagiis. Yaagin Miikaala, "I tana, Tana kessada yedda; hinna xayikko, taani nena worana yaagiis" yaagada zaaraasu.

English Sentences: So David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. And he and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti baqati attidi, Raaman de7iya Sameelakko biis; biidi Saa7ooli bana oottido ubbabaa Sameelayyo yootiis. Inne Sameeli Raaman de7iya Naayoota giyoosan biidi uttidosona.

English Sentences: And it was told Saul, saying, Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli, "Daawiti Raaman de7iya Naayootan de7ees" yaagiyoogaa siyiis.

English Sentences: And Saul sent messengers to take David: and when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as appointed over them, the Spirit of God was upon the messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siyidi Daawita omooddana mala, asaa yaa kiittiis. SHin hananabaa yootiyaageetu citai hananabaa yootishiininne Sameelikka eqqidi eta kaalettishin eti be7ido wode, Saa7ooli yeddido asatu bolli Xoossaa Ayyaanai wodhdhiis; wodhdhin etikka hananabaa yootidosona.

English Sentences: And when it was told Saul, he sent other messengers, and they prophesied likewise. And Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they prophesied also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli hegaa siyido wode, hara asaa yeddiis; etikka qassi hananabaa yootidosona. Saa7ooli heezzantto asaa yeddiis; yeddin hegeetikka hananabaa yootidosona.

English Sentences: Then went he also to Ramah, and came to a great well that is in Sechu: and he asked and said, Where are Samuel and David? And one said, Behold, they be at Naioth in Ramah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, i ba huuphiyau Raama baanau denddiis; biidi Seekon de7iya gita ollaa gakkiis; gakkidi, "Sameelinne Daawitinne awan de7iyoonaa?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin eti, "Hinin Raaman de7iya Naayootan de7oosona" yaagidi zaaridosona.

English Sentences: And he went thither to Naioth in Ramah: and the Spirit of God was upon him also, and he went on, and prophesied, until he came to Naioth in Ramah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Saa7ooli Raaman de7iya Naayoota biis; qassi Xoossaa Ayyaanai a bollikka wodhdhiis; wodhdhin Raaman de7iya Naayoota gakkanaashin, hananabaa yootiiddi biis.

English Sentences: And he stripped off his clothes also, and prophesied before Samuel in like manner, and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Wherefore they say, Is Saul also among the prophets?
Wolaitta Sentences: Bi gakkidi, ba maayuwaa qaaridi, Sameela sinttan hananabaa yootiis; he gallassa ubbaanne qammaa ubbaa kallo zin77iis. Asai, "Saa7oolikka hananabaa yootiyaageetu zateeyye?" giyoogee hegaassa.

English Sentences: And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan, What have I done? what is mine iniquity? and what is my sin before thy father, that he seeketh my life?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Daawiti Raaman de7iya Naayootappe baqatidi, Yonaataanakko biis; biidi Yonaataana, "Taani ai oottidanaa? Ta mooroi aibee? Ne aawai tana woranau koyiyoogee, taani a waata qohiinee?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto him, God forbid; thou shalt not die: behold, my father will do nothing either great or small, but that he will shew it me: and why should my father hide this thing from me? it is not so.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin Yonaataani, "Hegee neeppe haakko! Neeni haiqqakka. Be7a, guuttabaa gidin, gitabaa gidin, ta aawai taayyo yootennan de7iiddi aibanne oottenna. Ta aawai ha yohuwaa taappe aissi qottii? Hegaatto gidenna!" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: And David sware moreover, and said, Thy father certainly knoweth that I have found grace in thine eyes; and he saith, Let not Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved: but truly as the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, there is but a step between me and death.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Daawiti Yonaataana, "Neeni tana siiqiyoogaa ne aawai keehi erees; ne aawai baayyo, Yonaataani ha yohuwaa eroppo; erikko i azzanana! yaagiis. SHin de7o Xoossai ero; ne shemppoi ero; taappenne haiquwaappe gidduwan mexi issi tanggoi attiis" yaagidi caaqqiis.

English Sentences: Then said Jonathan unto David, Whatsoever thy soul desireth, I will even do it for thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Caaqqin Yonaataani, "Neeni ootta giidobaa aibanne taani neeyyo oottana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And David said unto Jonathan, Behold, to morrow is the new moon, and I should not fail to sit with the king at meat: but let me go, that I may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Daawiti hagaadan yaagiis; "Siya, wonttoi aginaa xeeruwaa bonchchiyo gallassa; taani kawuwaara qumaa maana koshshees. SHin taani baada wontti pe7in omarssi gakkanaashin, gaden qosettana.

English Sentences: If thy father at all miss me, then say, David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Bethlehem his city: for there is a yearly sacrifice there for all the family.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aawai tana koyikko, neeni a, Daawitanttaso asai ubbai laittaa yarshshuwaa yarshshiyo wode gidiyo gishshau, Beetaliheeme ba katamaa eesuwan baana giidi, tana oichchidi biis yaaga.

English Sentences: If he say thus, It is well; thy servant shall have peace: but if he be very wroth, then be sure that evil is determined by him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i, Yaanikko lo77o yaagikko, tau ne ashkkarau saro; shin i hanqqettikko, i tana qohanau ba qofaa qachchidoogaa hegan era.

English Sentences: Therefore thou shalt deal kindly with thy servant; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of the LORD with thee: notwithstanding, if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father?
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena gidikko, neeni taayyo ne ashkkaraayyo kehabaa ootta; aissi giikko, neeni tanaara ne ashkkaraara GODAA sinttan maacettadasa. SHin tanan mooroi de7ikko, tana neeni wora! Ne aawaassi tana aatta immoppa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan said, Far be it from thee: for if I knew certainly that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yonaataani, "Hegee neeppe haakko! Ta aawai nena qohanau ba qofaa qachchidobaa taani eridaakko, neeyyo yootikkinaayye?" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: Then said David to Jonathan, Who shall tell me? or what if thy father answer thee roughly?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Daawiti, "Ne aawai neeyyo iita zaaruwaa zaarikko, taayyo yootanai oonee?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan said unto David, Come, and let us go out into the field. And they went out both of them into the field.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin Yonaataani, "Haaya; gade boos" yaagiis; yaatin, naa77aikka gade biidosona.

English Sentences: And Jonathan said unto David, O LORD God of Israel, when I have sounded my father about to morrow any time, or the third day, and, behold, if there be good toward David, and I then send not unto thee, and shew it thee;
Wolaitta Sentences: Bin Yonaataani Daawita hagaadan yaagiis; "GODAI Israa7eela Xoossai ero, taani wontti pe7in ta aawaa qorana. I neeyyo keha qoppikko, taani kiittada nena erissana.

English Sentences: The LORD do so and much more to Jonathan: but if it please my father to do thee evil, then I will shew it thee, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace: and the LORD be with thee, as he hath been with my father.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ta aawai nena qohanau koyidabaa gidikko, qassi hegaa taani nena erissennan aggikkonne nena saron moissa yeddennan aggikko, GODAI taayyo iito! GODAI ta aawaara issippe gididoogaadan nenaarakka issippe gido.

English Sentences: And thou shalt not only while yet I live shew me the kindness of the LORD, that I die not:
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana asi worennaadan ta de7o laitta ubban aggenna siiquwaa, GODAAGAA malaa taayyo ootta.

English Sentences: But also thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever: no, not when the LORD hath cut off the enemies of David every one from the face of the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi GODAI Daawita morkketa ubbaa biittaappe xoqollido wodekka, ta keettaa asaappe ne siiquwaa haassoppa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David, saying, Let the LORD even require it at the hand of David's enemies.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Yonaataani, "GODAI Daawita morkketa achcho" yaagidi Daawita keettaa asaara maachchaa maacettiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan caused David to swear again, because he loved him: for he loved him as he loved his own soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yonaataani Daawita ba huuphedan siiqido gishshau, "Neeni tana tumu siiqiyoogaa qonccissanau ane taayyo naa77anttuwaa caaqqa" yaagidi caaqettiis.

English Sentences: Then Jonathan said to David, To morrow is the new moon: and thou shalt be missed, because thy seat will be empty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Yonaataani Daawita, "Wontto aginaa xeeruwaa bonchchiyo gallassa; neeni uttiyo sohoi mela de7ikko, neeni bainnaagee erettana.

English Sentences: And when thou hast stayed three days, then thou shalt go down quickly, and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself when the business was in hand, and shalt remain by the stone Ezel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wontti pe7in omarssi baada, ha metoi doommido gallassi neeni qosettidosan qosetta; qosettada Exela giyo zaallaappe guyyeera takkashsha.

English Sentences: And I will shoot three arrows on the side thereof, as though I shot at a mark.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani aibakko zambbiyaabaa milatada, a miyyessaara heezzu zubbeta wonddafiyan dukkana.

English Sentences: And, behold, I will send a lad, saying, Go, find out the arrows. If I expressly say unto the lad, Behold, the arrows are on this side of thee, take them; then come thou: for there is peace to thee, and no hurt; as the LORD liveth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, ta ashkkaraa, Baada zubbeta koya yaagada kiittana; taani a kiittaidda, Be7a; zubbeti neeppe ha baggaara de7oosona; taakko ekkada ya yaagiyaabaa gidikko, haaya; aissi giikko, de7o GODAI ero, neeyyo sa7i saro; nena aibinne bochchenna.

English Sentences: But if I say thus unto the young man, Behold, the arrows are beyond thee; go thy way: for the LORD hath sent thee away.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani ta ashkkaraa, Be7a; zubbeti neeppe hini baggaara de7oosona yaagiyaabaa gidikko, neeni aggada ba; aissi giikko, GODAI nena wora yeddiis.

English Sentences: And as touching the matter which thou and I have spoken of, behold, the LORD be between thee and me for ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeninne taani haasayido maachchaa gidikko, hegau neeppenne taappe gidduwan GODAI merinaayyo markka" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So David hid himself in the field: and when the new moon was come, the king sat him down to eat meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Daawiti gaden qosettiis. Aginaa xeeruwaa bonchchiyo gallassai gakkido wode, Kawoi Saa7ooli qumaa maanau yiis.

English Sentences: And the king sat upon his seat, as at other times, even upon a seat by the wall: and Jonathan arose, and Abner sat by Saul's side, and David's place was empty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yiidi haroode ba uttiyo sohuwan godaa lanqqen uttiis; Yonaataani appe sintta baazzan uttiis; Abaneeri Saa7oola lanqqen uttiis; shin Daawita sohoi mela de7ees.

English Sentences: Nevertheless Saul spake not any thing that day: for he thought, Something hath befallen him, he is not clean; surely he is not clean.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli he gallassa ainne gibeenna; aissi giikko, Saa7ooli, "Daawiti aibakko haniis; he gallassaa bonchchennaadan tuniis; tuma i tuniis" yaagidi qoppiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass on the morrow, which was the second day of the month, that David's place was empty: and Saul said unto Jonathan his son, Wherefore cometh not the son of Jesse to meat, neither yesterday, nor to day?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin wonttetta gallassikka, aginau naa77antto gallassi Daawita sohoi mela de7ees. Saa7ooli ba na7aa Yonaataana, "Isseya na7ai zinokka hachchikka qumaa maanau aibissi yibeennee?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan answered Saul, David earnestly asked leave of me to go to Bethlehem:
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin Yonaataani, "Daawiti Beetaliheeme baana giidi tana oichchiis;

English Sentences: And he said, Let me go, I pray thee; for our family hath a sacrifice in the city; and my brother, he hath commanded me to be there: and now, if I have found favour in thine eyes, let me get away, I pray thee, and see my brethren. Therefore he cometh not unto the king's table.
Wolaitta Sentences: i tana, Nu keettaa asai kataman yarshshuwaa yarshshiyo gishshaunne ta ishaikka tana azazido gishshau, hai tana yeddarkkii; neeni tana siiqiyaabaa gidikko, ane taani ta ishantta be7anau bais yaagiis. Kawuwaa maadaappe maanau i yibeennaagee hegaa gishshassa" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: Then Saul's anger was kindled against Jonathan, and he said unto him, Thou son of the perverse rebellious woman, do not I know that thou hast chosen the son of Jesse to thine own confusion, and unto the confusion of thy mother's nakedness?
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli Yonaataana bolli hanqquwaa eexxi kiyidi hagaadan yaagiis; "Laa geellanne makkalanchcha mishiree na7au, neeni ne huuphen kauyyanaunne nena yelida ne aayyiyo kaushshanau neeni Isseya na7aa bagga gididoogaa taani erikkinaayye?

English Sentences: For as long as the son of Jesse liveth upon the ground, thou shalt not be established, nor thy kingdom. Wherefore now send and fetch him unto me, for he shall surely die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Isseya na7ai ha sa7aa bollan de7ido peeshan ubban neeni woikko ne kawotettai eqqenna. Ha77i kiittada taayyo a ehiissa; aissi giikko, i haiqqanau bessees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said unto him, Wherefore shall he be slain? what hath he done?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yonaataani ba aawaa Saa7oola, "I aibissi haiqqii? I oottidobi aibee?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And Saul cast a javelin at him to smite him: whereby Jonathan knew that it was determined of his father to slay David.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin Saa7ooli Yonaataana woranau tooraa a bolli xonggiis. Hegaa gishshau, Yonaataani ba aawai Daawita woranau qofaa qachchidoogaa eriis.

English Sentences: So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and did eat no meat the second day of the month: for he was grieved for David, because his father had done him shame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eridi, hanqquwaa suulliiddi maadaappe denddi eqqiis; ba aawai Daawita kaushshido gishshau Yonaataani azzanidi, he aginau naa77antto gallassaa mibeenna.

English Sentences: And it came to pass in the morning, that Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David, and a little lad with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maallado Yonaataani Daawitaara gaittanau gade biis; biidi banaara issi yelaga na7aa ekki biis.

English Sentences: And he said unto his lad, Run, find out now the arrows which I shoot. And as the lad ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yonaataani na7aa, "Taani wonddafiyan dukkiyo zubbeta woxxada koya" yaagiis; yaagin na7ai woxxiyo wode, zubbiyaa hefintti dukkiis.

English Sentences: And when the lad was come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the lad, and said, Is not the arrow beyond thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7ai Yonaataana zubbee wodhdhido sohuwaa gakkido wode, Yonaataani na7aa xeegidi, "Zubbee neeppe hini baggaara de7ennee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan cried after the lad, Make speed, haste, stay not. And Jonathan's lad gathered up the arrows, and came to his master.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka Yonaataani na7aa, "Eesota; ellellada ba; eqqoppa!" yaagidi ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi odiis. He na7ai zubbiyaa maxidi ekkidi, ba godaakko ehiis.

English Sentences: But the lad knew not any thing: only Jonathan and David knew the matter.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7ai ha yohuwaa ainne erenna; Yonaataananne Daawita xalaalai eroosona.

English Sentences: And Jonathan gave his artillery unto his lad, and said unto him, Go, carry them to the city.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yonaataani ba ola miishshaa na7aassi immidi, "Tookka ekkada katamaa efa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And as soon as the lad was gone, David arose out of a place toward the south, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed himself three times: and they kissed one another, and wept one with another, until David exceeded.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7ai biidoogaappe guyyiyan, Daawiti he zaallaa guyyeppe kiyiis; kiyidi Yonaataana sinttan gulbbatidi, ba som77uwaa biittaa boshissidi heezzutoo ziggiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, issoi issuwaara yerettidi yeekkidosona; shin Daawiti Yonaataanappe aaruwaa yeekkiis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan said to David, Go in peace, forasmuch as we have sworn both of us in the name of the LORD, saying, The LORD be between me and thee, and between my seed and thy seed for ever. And he arose and departed: and Jonathan went into the city.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yonaataani Daawita, "Saro ba; Ne giddooninne ta giddon, ne zerettaa giddooninne ta zerettaa giddon, GODAI merinaayyo markka de7o yaagidi nuuni naa77ai GODAA sunttan caaqqida" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, Daawiti denddidi biis; Yonaataanikka katamaa guyye simmiis.

English Sentences: Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech the priest: and Ahimelech was afraid at the meeting of David, and said unto him, Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti qeesiyaa Abimelekakko Nooba katamaa biis; Abimeleki Daawitaara gaittanau kokkoriiddi yiidi, "Neeni aibissi nerkka de7ai? Aibissi hara asi nenaara de7ennee?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And David said unto Ahimelech the priest, The king hath commanded me a business, and hath said unto me, Let no man know any thing of the business whereabout I send thee, and what I have commanded thee: and I have appointed my servants to such and such a place.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin Daawiti qeesiyaa Abimeleka, "Kawoi tana, Taani nena kiittido yohuwaanne azazido azazuwaa ooninne eroppo yaagidi tana issibaa azaziis. Ta asati issi sohuwan tanaara gaittanaadan yootaas.

English Sentences: Now therefore what is under thine hand? give me five loaves of bread in mine hand, or what there is present.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha77i ne kushiyan aibi de7ii? Ichchashu bashe oitta woikko de7idabaa aibanne taayyo immarkkii" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the priest answered David, and said, There is no common bread under mine hand, but there is hallowed bread; if the young men have kept themselves at least from women.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin qeesee Daawita, "Asi ubbi miyo oitti taayyo baawa; shin geeshsha oittai de7ees; he asati banttana maccaasappe naagidabaa gidikko, eti maanau danddayoosona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And David answered the priest, and said unto him, Of a truth women have been kept from us about these three days, since I came out, and the vessels of the young men are holy, and the bread is in a manner common, yea, though it were sanctified this day in the vessel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Daawiti qeesiyaa, "Tuma nuuni ha kiitau kiyoosappe doommidi, maccaasaappe naagettida; harai atto geeshsha gidenna kiitaa wodekka eta asatettai geeshsha; hachchi usa aadhdhidi geeyanau koshshennee!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So the priest gave him hallowed bread: for there was no bread there but the shewbread, that was taken from before the LORD, to put hot bread in the day when it was taken away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, qeesee Daawitayyo geeshsha oittaa immiis; aissi giikko, qeesiyaayyo de7iyai ho77iya oittaa a sohuwan wottanau GODAA sinttappe denttido geeshsha oittaa xalaala.

English Sentences: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before the LORD; and his name was Doeg, an Edomite, the chiefest of the herdmen that belonged to Saul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7oola ashkkaratuppe issi bitanee he gallassa GODAA sinttan naagiiddi de7ees; a sunttai Doiqa; i Eedooma biittaa asa; Saa7oola mehiyaa heemmiyaageetuyyo i halaqa.

English Sentences: And David said unto Ahimelech, And is there not here under thine hand spear or sword? for I have neither brought my sword nor my weapons with me, because the king's business required haste.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Abimeleka, "Toori woikko bisoi neeyyo de7anddeeshsha? Kawuwaa kiitai eesoyido gishshau, taani ta bisuwaa woikko hara ola miishshaa ehabeikke" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And the priest said, The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom thou slewest in the valley of Elah, behold, it is here wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod: if thou wilt take that, take it: for there is no other save that here. And David said, There is none like that; give it me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin Abimeleki, "Neeni Eela Zanggaaran worido Pilisxxeemiyaa Gooliyaada bisoi hagan de7ees; curqqan i xaaxettidi, eefuudiyaa giyo maayuwaappe guyye baggaara de7ees. Neeni koyiyaabaa gidikko a ekka; appe attin, hara bisoi hagan baawa" yaagidi zaariis. Yaagin Daawiti, "Hegaa mala hara bisoi baawa; a taayyo hamma" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And David arose, and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassi Daawiti denddidi, Saa7oolappe baqatidi, Gaate katamaa Kawuwaa Akiishakko biis.

English Sentences: And the servants of Achish said unto him, Is not this David the king of the land? did they not sing one to another of him in dances, saying, Saul hath slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Akiisha oosanchchati, "Hagee Daawiti ba biittan kawo gidenneeyye? Qassi maccaasati yexxiiddinne duriiddi, Saa7ooli sha7aa woriis; Daawiti tammu sha7aa woriis yaagidi sabbido bitaniyaa gidenneeyye?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And David laid up these words in his heart, and was sore afraid of Achish the king of Gath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti eta haasayaa ba wozanan oiqqidi, Gaate Kawuwaa Akiisha keehippe yayyiis.

English Sentences: And he changed his behaviour before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down upon his beard.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Daawiti eta sinttan wozani boshettido asa milatiis; eti a oiqqana haniyo wode, gooyiyaabaadan kare penggiyaa ifittaa qaaceretteesinne buuchchaara duge zaaridi saassuwaa lokkayees.

English Sentences: Then said Achish unto his servants, Lo, ye see the man is mad: wherefore then have ye brought him to me?
Wolaitta Sentences: Akiishi ba oosanchchatuyyo, "Be7ite; hagee bitanee gooyees. Intte aissi a taakko ehiidetii?

English Sentences: Have I need of mad men, that ye have brought this fellow to play the mad man in my presence? shall this fellow come into my house?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha bitanee ta sinttan gooyanaadan intte ehiidoogee, ta matan hari gooyiyaabi xayiineeyye? Ha bitanee ta soo gelanau bessiiyye?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: David therefore departed thence, and escaped to the cave Adullam: and when his brethren and all his father's house heard it, they went down thither to him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Gaate katamaappe baqatidi, Adulaama katamaa matan de7iya gonggoluwaa biis; a ishanttinne a aawaa so asai ubbai hegaa siyido wode, eti yaa duge akko wodhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And every one that was in distress, and every one that was in debt, and every one that was discontented, gathered themselves unto him; and he became a captain over them: and there were with him about four hundred men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Metootidaageeti, woikko acuwan gelidaageeti, woikko sa7ai iitidoogeeti ubbati Daawitakko shiiqidosona; shiiqin i etayyo halaqa gidiis. Issi oiddu xeetaa gidiya asai aara de7ees.

English Sentences: And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab: and he said unto the king of Moab, Let my father and my mother, I pray thee, come forth, and be with you, till I know what God will do for me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti he sohuwaappe denddidi, Moo7aaban de7iya Mixiphpha biis; biidi Moo7aaba kawuwaa, "Xoossai taayyo oottanabaa taani erana gakkanaassi ta aayyiyoonne ta aawaa ne achchan wotissarkkii" yaagidi woossiis.

English Sentences: And he brought them before the king of Moab: and they dwelt with him all the while that David was in the hold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Daawiti eta Moo7aaba kawuwaa achchan wottiis; qatuwaa giddon Daawiti qosetti uttido wode ubban eti kawuwaa achchan de7idosona.

English Sentences: And the prophet Gad said unto David, Abide not in the hold; depart, and get thee into the land of Judah. Then David departed, and came into the forest of Hareth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, hananabaa yootiya Gaadi Daawitakko yiidi, "Qatuwaa giddon gam77oppa; ha sohuwaappe denddada Yihudaa biitti ba" yaagiis; yaagin Daawiti he sohuwaappe Hereta woraa biis.

English Sentences: When Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men that were with him, (now Saul abode in Gibeah under a tree in Ramah, having his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing about him;)
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawitinne a asai beettidoogaa Saa7ooli siyiis; Saa7ooli Gib77a katamaa matan de7iya keran, taamaariskka giyo mittaa garssan tooraa oiqqidi uttiis; a oosanchchati a dooddidi eqqidosona.

English Sentences: Then Saul said unto his servants that stood about him, Hear now, ye Benjamites; will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards, and make you all captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds;
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli eta, "Inttenoo, Biniyaama asatoo, siyite! Isseya na7ai goshshaanne woiniyaa tokkiyoosaa intte ubbaayyo immanee? SHaalaqatanne mato halaqata oottidi inttena sunttanee?

English Sentences: That all of you have conspired against me, and there is none that sheweth me that my son hath made a league with the son of Jesse, and there is none of you that is sorry for me, or sheweth unto me that my son hath stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ubbai ta bolli maqettideta; ta na7ai Isseya na7aara maachchaa maacettidoogaa ooninne taayyo yootibeenna. Intteppe issi asinne taayyo qarettenna; hachchiigaadankka ta na7ai ta ashkkaraa tana worissanau denttidoogaa ooninne taayyo yootibeenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then answered Doeg the Edomite, which was set over the servants of Saul, and said, I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Saa7oola oosanchchatuura eqqida Eedoomiyaa Doiqi Saa7oola, "Isseya na7ai Ahixuuba na7aa Abimelekakko Nooba katamaa biidaagaa taani be7aas.

English Sentences: And he enquired of the LORD for him, and gave him victuals, and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abimeleki Daawiti oottanabaa GODAA oichchiis; yaatidi Daawitayyo shinqqiyaa immiis; qassi Pilisxxeemiyaa Gooliyaada bisuwaakka ayyo immiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father's house, the priests that were in Nob: and they came all of them to the king.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Ahixuuba na7aa qeesiyaa Abimelekanne Nooba kataman qeese gididi de7iya a aawaa so asaa ubbaa kawoi xeesissin, eti kawuwaakko yiidosona.

English Sentences: And Saul said, Hear now, thou son of Ahitub. And he answered, Here I am, my lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli Abimeleka, "Ahixuuba na7au, siya" yaagiis. Yaagin Abimeleki, "Ero ta godau" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Saul said unto him, Why have ye conspired against me, thou and the son of Jesse, in that thou hast given him bread, and a sword, and hast enquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli a, "Neeninne Isseya na7ai ta bolli aibissi maqettidetii? Neeni ayyo oittaanne bisuwaa immada, i tana woranau denddana mala, ayyo Xoossaa aissi oichchadii?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Ahimelech answered the king, and said, And who is so faithful among all thy servants as David, which is the king's son in law, and goeth at thy bidding, and is honourable in thine house?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Abimeleki kawuwaa, "Ne ashkkaratu ubbaa giddon Daawitadan ammanettiyai, kawuwaara bollotidai, nena naagiyaageeta azaziyainne ne so asaa giddon keehippe bonchchettiyai hari oonee?

English Sentences: Did I then begin to enquire of God for him? be it far from me: let not the king impute any thing unto his servant, nor to all the house of my father: for thy servant knew nothing of all this, less or more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ayyo Xoossaa oichchishin, hagee tau koiro? Akkaikka! Kawuwau, tana ne ashkkaraa woikko ta aawaa so asa ubbaa ainne mootoppa; aissi giikko, taani ne ashkkarai ha yohuwaa guutta gidin gita gidinkka mule erikke" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the king said, Thou shalt surely die, Ahimelech, thou, and all thy father's house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin kawoi, "Abimelekaa, neeninne ne aawaa keettaa asai ubbai haiqqana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the king said unto the footmen that stood about him, Turn, and slay the priests of the LORD: because their hand also is with David, and because they knew when he fled, and did not shew it to me. But the servants of the king would not put forth their hand to fall upon the priests of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Saa7ooli ba matan eqqidi naagiyaageeta, "GODAA qeeseta worite; aissi giikko, etikka Daawita maaddidosona; Daawiti baqatidoogaa eriiddi, taayyo yootibookkona" yaagiis. SHin kawuwaa oosanchchati GODAA qeesetu bolli bantta kushiyaa wottennan ixxidosona.

English Sentences: And the king said to Doeg, Turn thou, and fall upon the priests. And Doeg the Edomite turned, and he fell upon the priests, and slew on that day fourscore and five persons that did wear a linen ephod.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanin kawoi Doiqa, "Qeeseta neeni wora" yaagidi azaziis. Azazin Eedoomiyaa Doiqi qeeseta shociis; shocidi he gallassi eefuudiyaa maayida hosppun tammanne ichchashu qeeseta i woriis.

English Sentences: And Nob, the city of the priests, smote he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and sucklings, and oxen, and asses, and sheep, with the edge of the sword.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa bollikka qeesetu katamaa, Nooba qara bisuwan busakkiis; he kataman de7iya attumaa, maccaa, naata, yiirata, meheta, haretanne dorssata qara bisuwan Doiqi suppu oottiis.

English Sentences: And one of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped, and fled after David.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Ahixuuba na7aa Abimeleka naatuppe Abiyaataara geetettiya issi na7ai kessi ekkidi, Daawitakko baqatiis.

English Sentences: And Abiathar shewed David that Saul had slain the LORD's priests.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baqati biidi, Saa7ooli GODAA qeeseta woridoogaa Daawitayyo yootiis.

English Sentences: And David said unto Abiathar, I knew it that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul: I have occasioned the death of all the persons of thy father's house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Abiyaataara, "Eedoomiyaa Doiqi he sohuwan de7iyoogaa taani be7ido wode, i Saa7oolayyo yootanaagaa he gallassi eraas. Ne aawaa so asaa ubbaa haiquwau oishettiyai tana.

English Sentences: Abide thou with me, fear not: for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life: but with me thou shalt be in safeguard.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi neeni tanaara de7a; yayyoppa. Nena woranau koyiya urai tana woranau koyiyaagaa; shin neeni ta achchan saro de7ana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then they told David, saying, Behold, the Philistines fight against Keilah, and they rob the threshingfloors.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Pilisxxeema asati Qa7iila katamaa oloosona; audiyaakka bonqqoosona" yaagiyo oduwaa Daawiti siyiis.

English Sentences: Therefore David enquired of the LORD, saying, Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And the LORD said unto David, Go, and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siyidi Daawiti GODAA, "Taani baada Pilisxxeema asata oloo?" yaagidi oichchiis. GODAI Daawita, "Ba; Pilisxxeema asata ola; Qa7iila katamaa ashsha" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And David's men said unto him, Behold, we be afraid here in Judah: how much more then if we come to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Daawita asati, "Nuuni hagan Yihudaa biittan de7iiddinne yayyoos; shin Pilisxxeema asatuura olettanau nuuni Qa7iila katamaa biiddi, waani aatti yayyanddoniishsha!" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Then David enquired of the LORD yet again. And the LORD answered him and said, Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into thine hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Daawiti zaarettidi GODAA oichchiis; oichchin GODAI a, "Pilisxxeema asata taani neeyyo aatta immana; dendda; denddada Qa7iila katamaa ba" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and smote them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawitinne a asai Qa7iila katamaa biidi, Pilisxxeema asatuura olettidosona; olettidi eta mehiyaa di77idosona. Etappe daro asaa woridi, Daawiti Qa7iila katamaa asaa ashshiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that he came down with an ephod in his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abimeleka na7ai Abiyaataari Daawitakko Qa7iila katamaa baqatiyo wode, eefuudiyaa giyo maayuwaa ekki biis.

English Sentences: And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah. And Saul said, God hath delivered him into mine hand; for he is shut in, by entering into a town that hath gates and bars.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Qa7iila katamaa biidoogaa Saa7ooli siyiis; siyidi, "Xoossai Daawita ta kushiyan aatti immiis; aissi giikko, ifittainne hiraaqoi de7iyo katamaa gelidi, barkka qashettiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Saul called all the people together to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qa7iila katamaa biidi, Daawitanne a asaa dooddana mala, Saa7ooli ba olanchchata ubbaa xeesiis.

English Sentences: And David knew that Saul secretly practised mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest, Bring hither the ephod.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli ba bolli iitabaa maqettidoogaa Daawiti eriis; eridi qeesiyaa Abiyaataara, "Eefuudiyaa haa ekka ya" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then said David, O LORD God of Israel, thy servant hath certainly heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Daawiti, "Abeet GODAU, Israa7eela Xoossau, ta gaasuwan Saa7ooli Qa7iila katamaa bashshanau maqettidoogaa taani ne ashkkarai wurssada siyaas.

English Sentences: Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? will Saul come down, as thy servant hath heard? O LORD God of Israel, I beseech thee, tell thy servant. And the LORD said, He will come down.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qa7iila katamaa asai tana Saa7oolayyo aattidi immaneeshsha? Taani ne ashkkarai siyidoogaadan Saa7ooli tumukka haa yaaneeshsha? Abeet GODAU, Israa7eela Xoossau, taayyo ne ashkkaraayyo yootarkkii" yaagiis. Yaagin GODAI Daawita, "Ee; Saa7ooli yaana" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: Then said David, Will the men of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul? And the LORD said, They will deliver thee up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti, "Qa7iila katamaa asati tananne ta asaa Saa7oolayyo aattidi immaneeshsha?" yaagidi zaarettidikka GODAA oichchiis. Oichchin GODAI, "Ee; eti inttena aattidi immana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then David and his men, which were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whithersoever they could go. And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he forbare to go forth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawitinne usuppun xeetu gidiya asai Qa7iila katamaappe kiyidi, issisaappe issisaa hemetaa oiqqidosona. Daawiti Qa7iila katamaappe baqatidoogaa Saa7ooli siyido wode, baanau qoppidoogaa aggi bayiis.

English Sentences: And David abode in the wilderness in strong holds, and remained in a mountain in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him every day, but God delivered him not into his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti bazzo qatotuuninne Ziifa bazzuwan de7iya keratun de7iis. Saa7ooli a demmanau ubba gallassi koyees; shin Xoossai a Saa7oola kushiyan aatti immibeenna.

English Sentences: And David saw that Saul was come out to seek his life: and David was in the wilderness of Ziph in a wood.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Ziifa bazzuwan de7iya Horeesha giyoosan de7ishin, Saa7ooli bana woranau kiyidoogaa Daawiti eriis.

English Sentences: And Jonathan Saul's son arose, and went to David into the wood, and strengthened his hand in God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7oola na7aa Yonaataani denddidi, Daawitakko Horeesha biis; biidi Daawita GODAN wolqqaa demmanaadan minttettiiddi,

English Sentences: And he said unto him, Fear not: for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my father knoweth.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yayyoppa; ta aawaa Saa7ooli nena kushiyaaninne bochchenna; neeni Israa7eela bolli kawotana; taanikka neeppe garssaara haarana; harai atto ta aawai Saa7oolikka hegaa erees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they two made a covenant before the LORD: and David abode in the wood, and Jonathan went to his house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti naa77aikka GODAA sinttan issoi issuwaara maacettidosona; Daawiti Horeeshan gam77in Yonaataani ba soo biis.

English Sentences: Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself with us in strong holds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of Jeshimon?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ziifa asati Saa7oolakko Gib77a katamaa biidi, "Daawiti Yasemoonappe tohossa baggaara Hakiila Deriyaa bolli Horeesha qatuwan nu matan qosetti uttiis.

English Sentences: Now therefore, O king, come down according to all the desire of thy soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver him into the king's hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nu kawuwau, ha77ikka neeni dosido wode haa duge wodhdha; yaatikko, nuuni a ne kushiyan aatti immana" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Saul said, Blessed be ye of the LORD; for ye have compassion on me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Saa7ooli eta, "Intte taayyo qarettido gishshau, inttena GODAI anjjo.

English Sentences: Go, I pray you, prepare yet, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who hath seen him there: for it is told me that he dealeth very subtilly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biidi ane gujjidikka geeshshite; Daawiti darotoo awa biyaakkonne qassi yan ooni a be7idaakko, qoridi erite; aissi giikko, i keehi cincca giyoogaa taani siyaas.

English Sentences: See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking places where he hideth himself, and come ye again to me with the certainty, and I will go with you: and it shall come to pass, if he be in the land, that I will search him out throughout all the thousands of Judah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti qosettiyo sohota ubbaa be7idi, muruta yohuwaa ekkidi, taakko simmidi yiite. Hegaappe guyyiyan, taani inttenaara baana; i he heeran de7ikko, taani a kumetta Yihudaa yaraa giddon demmana gakkanau koyana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they arose, and went to Ziph before Saul: but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the plain on the south of Jeshimon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, eti Saa7oolappe sinttatidi Ziifa biidosona. Daawitinne a asai Yasemoonappe tohossa baggaara de7iya Maa7oona bazzuwan Aaraba giyo garan de7oosona.

English Sentences: Saul also and his men went to seek him. And they told David: wherefore he came down into a rock, and abode in the wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, he pursued after David in the wilderness of Maon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7oolinne a asai Daawita koyanau biidosona. Daawiti hegaa siyido wode, zaallaakko wodhdhidi, Maa7oona bazzuwan uttiis. Saa7ooli hegaa siyido wode Maa7oona bazzuwaa Daawita koyiiddi biis.

English Sentences: And Saul went on this side of the mountain, and David and his men on that side of the mountain: and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men compassed David and his men round about to take them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli deriyaappe issi bagga miyyiyaara bees; Daawitinne a asai hinkko bagga miyyiyaara boosona. Eti Saa7oolappe baqatanau eesotoosona; aissi giikko, Saa7oolinne a asati, Daawitanne a asata oiqqanau mati uttidosona.

English Sentences: But there came a messenger unto Saul, saying, Haste thee, and come; for the Philistines have invaded the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin kiitettidaagee Saa7oolakko yiidi, "Haaya! Pilisxxeema asati biittaa bolli woraajjidosona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Wherefore Saul returned from pursuing after David, and went against the Philistines: therefore they called that place Selahammahlekoth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli Daawita koyiyoogaa aggidi, Pilisxxeema asatuura olettanau biis. Hegaa gishshau, he sohoi "SHaakkiya zaallaa" geetettiis.

English Sentences: And David went up from thence, and dwelt in strong holds at Engedi.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti he sohuwaappe kiyidi, Enggaada katamaa matan de7iya qatotun uttiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Saul was returned from following the Philistines, that it was told him, saying, Behold, David is in the wilderness of Engedi.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli Pilisxxeema asata yedettiyoosaappe simmin, "Daawiti Enggaada katamaa matan de7iya bazzuwan de7ees" giidi ayyo yootidosona.

English Sentences: Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men upon the rocks of the wild goats.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela ubbaa giddoppe doorettida heezzu sha7u asaa Saa7ooli ekkidi, Daawitanne a asaa koyanau, "Wora Deeshshati Geessiyo Zaallaa" giyoosaa mati biis.

English Sentences: And he came to the sheepcotes by the way, where was a cave; and Saul went in to cover his feet: and David and his men remained in the sides of the cave.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli ogiyaa doonan dorssaa birddiyaa matan de7iya gonggoluwaakko yiis; yiidi sheeshshau uttanau gonggoluwaa giddo geliis. Geliyo wode Daawitinne a asai gonggoluwaayyo giddokko shiiqidi uttidosona.

English Sentences: And the men of David said unto him, Behold the day of which the LORD said unto thee, Behold, I will deliver thine enemy into thine hand, that thou mayest do to him as it shall seem good unto thee. Then David arose, and cut off the skirt of Saul's robe privily.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawita asai a, " Hekko taani ne morkkiyaa ne kushiyan aatta immana; neeni a ne koyidoogaadan oottana yaagidi GODAI neeyyo yootido gallassai hachcha" yaagidosona. Daawiti Saa7oola erissennan shiiqidi, Saa7oola maayuwaa xeeraappe qanxxi ekkiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass afterward, that David's heart smote him, because he had cut off Saul's skirt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qanxxidoogaappe guyyiyan, Daawiti ba wozanan azzaniis.

English Sentences: And he said unto his men, The LORD forbid that I should do this thing unto my master, the LORD's anointed, to stretch forth mine hand against him, seeing he is the anointed of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azzanidi Daawiti ba asata, "GODAI tiyidi kawoyido ta godaa taani hegaa oottanaagaa woikko a bolli ta kushiyaa denttanaagaa GODAI taappe haasso; aissi giikko, GODAI tiyidi kawoyidoogee a" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So David stayed his servants with these words, and suffered them not to rise against Saul. But Saul rose up out of the cave, and went on his way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti hagaadan seeridi, Saa7oola ba asan boshissennan diggiis. Saa7ooli gonggoluwaa giddoppe kiyidi, ba ogiyan geliis.

English Sentences: David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying, My lord the king. And when Saul looked behind him, David stooped with his face to the earth, and bowed himself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saa7ooli biidoogaappe guyyiyan, Daawiti gonggoluwaa giddoppe kiyidi, Saa7oola, "Ta godau, kawuwau!" yaagidi xeesiis; xeesin Saa7ooli guyye simmidi xeelliis; Daawiti biittan duge gufannidi, Saa7oolayyo ziggiis.

English Sentences: And David said to Saul, Wherefore hearest thou men's words, saying, Behold, David seeketh thy hurt?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi Daawiti Saa7oola, " Daawiti nena qohanau koyees giya asatu qaalaa neeni aibissi siyai?

English Sentences: Behold, this day thine eyes have seen how that the LORD had delivered thee to day into mine hand in the cave: and some bade me kill thee: but mine eye spared thee; and I said, I will not put forth mine hand against my lord; for he is the LORD's anointed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha gonggoluwaa giddon GODAI nena hachchi taayyo aatti immidoogaa neeni ne aifiyan be7adasa; taani nena woranaadan amaridaageeti tana denttettidosona; shin taani, GODAI tiyidi kawoyidoogaa i gidiyo gishshau, taani ta godaa bolli ta kushiyaa denttikke yaagada nena ashshaas.

English Sentences: Moreover, my father, see, yea, see the skirt of thy robe in my hand: for in that I cut off the skirt of thy robe, and killed thee not, know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgression in mine hand, and I have not sinned against thee; yet thou huntest my soul to take it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta aawau, be7a; ta kushiyan de7iya ne maayuwaa xeeraa hagaa xeella! Ne maayuwaa xeeraappe qanxxa ekkaas; shin nena worabeikke; taani nena qohabeennaagaanne makkalabeennaagaa akeekada era; taani nena qohabeikke; shin neeni tana woranau shankkataasa.

English Sentences: The LORD judge between me and thee, and the LORD avenge me of thee: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nebaanne tabaa GODAI pirddo; GODAI neeni tana qohidoogaa haluwaa kesso; shin taani ne bolli ta kushiyaa denttikke.

English Sentences: As saith the proverb of the ancients, Wickedness proceedeth from the wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Beni wode, Iitaa oottiyaageetuppe iitabi kiyees yaagiyo leemisoi de7ees; hegaa gishshau, taani nena kushiyaaninne bochchikke.

English Sentences: After whom is the king of Israel come out? after whom dost thou pursue? after a dead dog, after a flea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela kawoi o bolli kiyidee? Neeni oona oiqqanau koyai? Haiqqida kanaa woikko kasttolliyaa koyai?

English Sentences: The LORD therefore be judge, and judge between me and thee, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thine hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI nu giddon daannato; nebaanne tabaa i pirddo; ta yohuwaa xeellidi, ta gishshau i mootetto; ne kushiyaappe tana i ashsho" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when David had made an end of speaking these words unto Saul, that Saul said, Is this thy voice, my son David? And Saul lifted up his voice, and wept.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti Saa7oolayyo haasayiyoogaa wurssido wode, Saa7ooli Daawita, "Ta na7au Daawitaa, hegee ne qaalee?" yaagiis; yaagidi Saa7ooli ba qaalaa xoqqissidi yeekkiis.

English Sentences: And he said to David, Thou art more righteous than I: for thou hast rewarded me good, whereas I have rewarded thee evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka Daawita, "Neeni taappe aadhdhida xillo; aissi giikko, taani neeyyo iitabaa oottin, neeni taayyo lo77obaa oottadasa.

English Sentences: And thou hast shewed this day how that thou hast dealt well with me: forasmuch as when the LORD had delivered me into thine hand, thou killedst me not.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI tana hachchi neeyyo aatti imminkka neeni tana worabeenna gishshau, taayyo neeni oottido lo77obaa tana bessadasa.

English Sentences: For if a man find his enemy, will he let him go well away? wherefore the LORD reward thee good for that thou hast done unto me this day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba morkke demmidi qohennan yeddiiyye? Neeni taayyo hachchi oottido kehatettaa gishshau, GODAI nena anjjo.

English Sentences: And now, behold, I know well that thou shalt surely be king, and that the kingdom of Israel shall be established in thine hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha77ikka neeni Israa7eelau kawo gidanaagaanne Israa7eela kawotettai ne maataa garssan eqqanaagaa taani erais.

English Sentences: Swear now therefore unto me by the LORD, that thou wilt not cut off my seed after me, and that thou wilt not destroy my name out of my father's house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha77i simmi taappe guyyiyan, ta zerettaa neeni duuttennaadaaninne ta sunttaakka ta aawaa keettaappe quccennaadan GODAA sunttan taayyo caaqqa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And David sware unto Saul. And Saul went home; but David and his men gat them up unto the hold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Daawiti Saa7oolayyo caaqqiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, Saa7ooli ba soo simmidi biis; Daawitinne a asai pude qatuwaa biidosona.

English Sentences: And Samuel died; and all the Israelites were gathered together, and lamented him, and buried him in his house at Ramah. And David arose, and went down to the wilderness of Paran.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sameeli haiqqiis; haiqqin Israa7eela asati ubbai shiiqidi, ayyo yeekkidosona; Raama kataman de7iya a son moogidosona. Hegaappe guyyiyan, Daawiti Paaraana bazzuwaa biis.

English Sentences: And there was a man in Maon, whose possessions were in Carmel; and the man was very great, and he had three thousand sheep, and a thousand goats: and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maa7oonan issi bitanee de7ees; he bitaniyaayyo aqoi Qarmmeloosan de7ees; i daro dure; issi sha7u deeshshatinne heezzu sha7u dorssati ayyo de7oosona. I eta ikisiyaa Qarmmeloosa kataman meedees.

English Sentences: Now the name of the man was Nabal; and the name of his wife Abigail: and she was a woman of good understanding, and of a beautiful countenance: but the man was churlish and evil in his doings; and he was of the house of Caleb.
Wolaitta Sentences: He bitaniyaa sunttai Naabaala; a keettaayee sunttai Abigaalo. A eranchchanne puulanchcha maccaasa; shin i keettaawai meqetti bainna iita asa. I Kaaleebaa yara.

English Sentences: And David heard in the wilderness that Nabal did shear his sheep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti bazzuwan de7iiddi, dorssaa ikisiyaa Naabaali meediyoogaa siyiis.

English Sentences: And David sent out ten young men, and David said unto the young men, Get you up to Carmel, and go to Nabal, and greet him in my name:
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti tammu wodallata hagaadan yaagidi kiittiis; "Naabaalakko Qarmmeloosa katamaa biidi, ta sunttan a sarotite;

English Sentences: And thus shall ye say to him that liveth in prosperity, Peace be both to thee, and peace be to thine house, and peace be unto all that thou hast.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saro de7ai! Neenikka ne keettaa asaikka saro! Neessi giidobai ubbai saro de7ii!

English Sentences: And now I have heard that thou hast shearers: now thy shepherds which were with us, we hurt them not, neither was there ought missing unto them, all the while they were in Carmel.
Wolaitta Sentences: " Neeni dorssaa ikisiyaa meediyoogaa taani siyaas; ne dorssaa heemmiyaageeti nunaara issippe de7ido wode, nuuni eta genibookko; eti Qarmmeloosa kataman uttido wode ubban etabaappe aibinne paccibeenna.

English Sentences: Ask thy young men, and they will shew thee. Wherefore let the young men find favour in thine eyes: for we come in a good day: give, I pray thee, whatsoever cometh to thine hand unto thy servants, and to thy son David.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa neeni ne ashkkarata oichchikko, eti neeyyo yootana. Nuuni hachchi gibira gallassi neekko yiido gishshau, ta wodalla asatussi hayyanaa keha; ne kushiyan de7iyaabaappe ne ashkkaratuyyoonne ne na7aa Daawitayyo hayyanaa imma yaagite" yaagidi azaziis.

English Sentences: And when David's young men came, they spake to Nabal according to all those words in the name of David, and ceased.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawita asati Naabaalakko gakkidi, Daawita kiitaa ayyo yootidosona; yootidi hegan naagidosona.

English Sentences: And Nabal answered David's servants, and said, Who is David? and who is the son of Jesse? there be many servants now a days that break away every man from his master.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naabaali Daawita ashkkarata, "Daawiti oonee? Isseya na7ai oonee? Ha wodiyan daro ashkkarati bantta godatuppe baqatoosona.

English Sentences: Shall I then take my bread, and my water, and my flesh that I have killed for my shearers, and give it unto men, whom I know not whence they be?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta oittaa, ta haattaanne ta dorssaa meediyaageetuyyo shukettida ashuwaa denttada, ha oonakkonne yiidosai erettenna asatuyyo aissi immoo?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So David's young men turned their way, and went again, and came and told him all those sayings.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Daawita asati simmidi guyye biidosona. Bi gakkidi Naabaali giidobaa ubbaa Daawitayyo yootidosona.

English Sentences: And David said unto his men, Gird ye on every man his sword. And they girded on every man his sword; and David also girded on his sword: and there went up after David about four hundred men; and two hundred abode by the stuff.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti ba asata, "Intte bisuwaa bisuwaa gixxite" yaagiis; yaagin ubbatikka bantta bisuwaa bisuwaa gixxidosona; Daawitikka ba bisuwaa gixxiis. Daawiti oiddu xeetaa gidiya asatuura pude biis; naa77u xeetu asai etabaa naagiiddi attiis.

English Sentences: But one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal's wife, saying, Behold, David sent messengers out of the wilderness to salute our master; and he railed on them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ashkkaratuppe issoi Naabaala keettaayyiyo Abigaalo hagaadan yaagiis; "Daawiti bazzuwan de7iiddi nu godaa, Saro gaanau asa kiittiis; shin i eta cayiis.

English Sentences: But the men were very good unto us, and we were not hurt, neither missed we any thing, as long as we were conversant with them, when we were in the fields:
Wolaitta Sentences: Gidikkokka, ha asati nuuyyo keehippe lo77o; eti nuna genibookkona; nuuni etaara issippe dembban pe7ido wode ubban nubaappe aibinne paccibeenna.

English Sentences: They were a wall unto us both by night and day, all the while we were with them keeping the sheep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni nu dorssaa wudiyaa eta matan heemmiyo wode, qamminne gallassi eti nuuyyo dirssa gididosona.

English Sentences: Now therefore know and consider what thou wilt do; for evil is determined against our master, and against all his household: for he is such a son of Belial, that a man cannot speak to him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hayyanaa ha yohuwaa waatanaakkonne qoppa; aissi giikko, nu godaa bollinne a so asaa bolli kobabai kiyana hanees. Nu godai hegaa mala meqetti bainna iita asa gidido gishshau, ooninne ayyo haasayanau danddayenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Abigail made haste, and took two hundred loaves, and two bottles of wine, and five sheep ready dressed, and five measures of parched corn, and an hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and laid them on asses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abigaala sohuwaarakka naa77u xeetu komppo oittaanne naa77u ogoro woine eessaa, xiixettida dorssata ichchashata, tammanne laappun kilo giraame tiyaa xiixaa, issi xeetu wurcco woiniyaa teeraanne balasiyaa lichchakuwaa melaappe naa77u xeetaa ekkada, hariyan caanaasu.

English Sentences: And she said unto her servants, Go on before me; behold, I come after you. But she told not her husband Nabal.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatada ashkkarata, "Intte taappe sinttau aadhdhidi biite; taani intte geeduwaa kaallana" yaagaasu; shin ba keettaawaa Naabaalayyo ainne yootabeikku.

English Sentences: And it was so, as she rode on the ass, that she came down by the covert of the hill, and, behold, David and his men came down against her; and she met them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba hariyaa toggada deriyaara duge zanggaaraa wodhdhiyo wode, Daawitinne a asai ikko simmidi duge wodhdhoosona; wodhdhin a etaara gaittaasu.

English Sentences: Now David had said, Surely in vain have I kept all that this fellow hath in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that pertained unto him: and he hath requited me evil for good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daawiti ba wozanan, "Abaappe aibinne paccennaadan taani ha bitaniyaa aquwaa ubbaa naagidoogee coo mela; taani lo77idoogaa kushiyaa i taayyo iitaa zaariis.

English Sentences: So and more also do God unto the enemies of David, if I leave of all that pertain to him by the morning light any that pisseth against the wall.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wontto maallado gakkanaashin, taani abaa gidida ubbaappe issi attumaanne paxa aggikko, Xoossi tana paxa aggoppo" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when Abigail saw David, she hasted, and lighted off the ass, and fell before David on her face, and bowed herself to the ground,
Wolaitta Sentences: Abigaala Daawita be7ido wode, hariyaappe eesota wodhdhada, Daawita sinttan biittan gufannada ayyo ziggaasu.

English Sentences: And fell at his feet, and said, Upon me, my lord, upon me let this iniquity be: and let thine handmaid, I pray thee, speak in thine audience, and hear the words of thine handmaid.
Wolaitta Sentences: A a tohuwan wullada, "Hai ta godau, ha mooroi ta xalaalaassa gido! Tana ne ashkkariyo haasayissarkkii; taani ne ashkkariyaa haasayiyoogaa siyarkkii.

English Sentences: Let not my lord, I pray thee, regard this man of Belial, even Nabal: for as his name is, so is he; Nabal is his name, and folly is with him: but I thine handmaid saw not the young men of my lord, whom thou didst send.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha meqetti bainna iita bitaniyaabaa, Naabaalabaa siyoppa; Naabaala giyoogee Eeya giyoogaa; i ba sunttaadankka eeya. Ta godau, neeni kiittido asata taani ne ashkkariyaa be7abeikke.

English Sentences: Now therefore, my lord, as the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, seeing the LORD hath withholden thee from coming to shed blood, and from avenging thyself with thine own hand, now let thine enemies, and they that seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal.
Wolaitta Sentences: "De7o GODAI ero! Ne shemppoi ero! Neeni suutta gussennaadaaninne ne kushen ne halo kessennaadan, nena ta godaa teqqidaagee GODAA. Ne morkketinne nena ta godaa qohanau koyiyaageeti Naabaaladan hanona.

English Sentences: And now this blessing which thine handmaid hath brought unto my lord, let it even be given unto the young men that follow my lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha imotai taani ne ashkkariyaa neeyyo ta godaayyo ehiidoogee nena kaalliya asatuyyo imetto.

English Sentences: I pray thee, forgive the trespass of thine handmaid: for the LORD will certainly make my lord a sure house; because my lord fighteth the battles of the LORD, and evil hath not been found in thee all thy days.
